task_summary: Fold a pink cloth on a tabletop by pushing along its edge after approaching and making gentle contact.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 arm must fold a pink cloth lying on a wooden tabletop. The arm first ensures the cloth is visible, approaches above it, aligns the end-effector, and orients the gripper for an edge push. It lowers until contact and executes a directed push to create a fold. After the push, the arm pauses to stabilize the cloth and then retreats. The sequence uses perception fallback with retries and conservative motions suitable for soft, deformable objects.
preconditions: Tabletop is clear except for the cloth
Camera provides view of the cloth
stepwise_plan: Verify cloth visibility or scan to locate it
Open gripper and move above target area
Align tool and set yaw for pushing direction
Lower until gentle contact with table/cloth
Push along cloth edge to fold it
success_criteria: A visible overlap indicating a fold
No object other than cloth displaced
Robot ends clear of the cloth
failure_and_recovery: If cloth not visible, rescan with retries
If contact not detected, re-approach and lower again
If push slips, reorient yaw and attempt a shorter push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the push completes and the arm has retreated to a safe distance.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Check if the cloth is already visible.
Scan the workspace to locate the cloth.
Move to a pre-push pose above the cloth.
Laterally align tool with the cloth edge.
Descend gently until contact with cloth/table.
Execute the folding push along the edge.
Let the fabric settle after motion.
Back away to a safe position.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected due to lighting or pose
Insufficient contact leading to no fold
Push direction misaligned causing drag without fold
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and lower again to re-establish contact
Adjust yaw and attempt a shorter push
Increase push distance within limits on second attempt
assumptions: Frames show push-based folding rather than grasp-and-fold; BT follows push strategy.
